meanings.definition: The theory that myths and legends are based on historical events or real people.
meanings.sent1: In euhemerism, stories of gods are seen as tales inspired by actual events.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often debate the validity of euhemerism in understanding ancient myths.
meanings.sent3: The euhemerism of the ancient tales made history come alive in a new way.
meanings.sent4: Her euhemerism shed light on the origins of folklore in a fascinating manner.
meanings.sent5: The concept of euhemerism helped connect the past to the present through storytelling.

meanings.definition: The practice of interpreting myths as historical accounts.
meanings.sent1: Euhemerism involves analyzing myths as if they were factual records.
meanings.sent2: Historians use euhemerism to uncover potential truths hidden in ancient stories.
meanings.sent3: The euhemerism of the legends turned the study of mythology into a detective game.
meanings.sent4: Through euhemerism, myths transform into windows to the past.
meanings.sent5: Teachers often use euhemerism to engage students in exploring the historical roots of myths.

meanings.definition: The belief that gods were once mortal beings.
meanings.sent1: Euhemerism suggests that deities were once regular people with extraordinary tales.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures embraced euhemerism as a way to humanize their gods.
meanings.sent3: The euhemerism of divine figures added a touch of whimsy to religious discussions.
meanings.sent4: In her stories, the author played with the idea of euhemerism by giving gods human flaws.
meanings.sent5: The concept of euhemerism invites us to see the divine through a lens of earthly experiences.
